arts.ttl: Andy Dawson provides Hull City manager update after Middlesbrough defeat
arts.sum: Andy Dawson expects to find out the next steps in Hull City's search for a new manager later this weekend after guiding the Tigers through a difficult game at Middlesbrough on Saturday lunchtime. Martin waved away those protests for a red card, and Boro went on to score two good goals, the second of which had a large hint of offside about it.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough fitness gamble pays off as Michael Carrick gives huge credit to players in Hull win
arts.sum: Bouncing back after the midweek defeat to Blackburn, Finn Azaz scored as one of three players who returned to the side after missing the last game, with Tommy Conway adding a brace to seal the 3-1 win. “Today was a tough game, and we expected it to be that way," Carrick reviewed after.

arts.ttl: Brilliant Ben Doak has fans swooning as deadly Scotland double act on fire for Middlesbrough
arts.sum: The red hot winger set up two goals for fellow Scot and Riverside teammate Tommy Conway in an EPL Championship masterclass

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings at Middlesbrough as two summer signings struggle badly
arts.sum: To their credit, City stuck in the game and got themselves back in it with 20 minutes to go when Abu Kamara's cross to the back post was headed in by Mason Burstow, off the bench just a minute earlier, only for Conway to grab his second and put the game beyond any doubt. Struggled to get into the game and came off early in the second half.

arts.ttl: Reason for hope despite Hull City losing fifth straight Championship game at Middlesbrough
arts.sum: City were not without threat, with Omur and Palmer both fizzing shots wide, albeit from distance but the game was effectively put to bed four minutes before the break when Doak again was afforded too much space to lift over a cross which Conway did brilliantly to head back across goal and into the far corner, another example of the gulf in quality in the final third between both sets of teams. The big talking point of the half came 20 minutes in when Palmer played Pedro through one-on-one and outside the box, he was pulled down by Neto Borges, but referee Martin and his assistant on the far side, opted to give nothing, bizarrely.

arts.ttl: Tommy Conway and Finn Azaz grab the goals as Middlesbrough return to winning ways against Hull
arts.sum: The returning Finn Azaz (2) and Tommy Conway scored the goals as Boro quickly put the disappointment of their midweek Blackburn Rovers defeat behind them to win a fourth game in five and stay in the top six. Hackney drove and played the ball ahead to Azaz who quickly turned it around the corner for Doak.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough impress again as Hull’s sorry run continues
What Middlesbrough boss Michael Carrick said on Hull City and Tim Walter's dismissal
arts.sum: Losing the goal in the way we did was a big blow, but you’ve got to use that to fire yourself up and get yourself ready for the weekend," Carrick said. That, Carrick says, makes it doubly difficult to prepare for a side that have lost their last fou and have only one clean sheet in their opening 17 games of these season.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick's upbeat Middlesbrough message as they look to bounce back against Hull City
arts.sum: "It’s a quick turnaround, and we’ll just have to pick the bodies that are fit and ready for Saturday. Looking ahead to the Hull game, he said: "There was disappointment after the game, and frustration at the goal as well.

arts.ttl: Ben Doak needs help from Middlesbrough team-mates as Liverpool loan star gets 'natural' treatment
arts.sum: Michael Carrick says it's natural that teams are starting to target Middlesbrough star Ben Doak, but he's confident his side can continue to share the load and help the Liverpool loanee continue to thrive. It meant the lively wide man was unable to have his usual impact in the game, even if he still managed to come closest to scoring for Boro when he smashed the post late on.
